HYxiUme-UYIbFszFhOaCXQ.text: Completely lives up to the reputation. Great quality huge portions fantastic food and service. The chicken and waffles were amazing. Game gumbo was great. Desserts on point. Cocktails were mixed perfectly. They have nailed the deep south, very impressive!

YopF4XTtyv3ENyxoc_H-pg.text: Came here with my mom when we visited London in early September (yes, I know- I am a little late writing this), and it was probably my favorite meal we had while in town. The people recognized us by name when we walked in, we were seated and served promptly, and everyone was extremely friendly. We had the fried pickles as a starter, I had the softshell crab burger, and my mom had the brisket. I still think about how amazing that food was. Next time I make it over to London, I am definitely going back.

r-81pcL3xtSM06_Plp9GqQ.text: This place is fun if you're looking for a (kind of) American meal, and good drinks. The atmosphere is pleasant and the waitstaff are nice. However if you're an American going here expecting true soul food or hearty BBQ, you will be disappointed. There is little to no spice in the food (although you can suplement with their broad array of hot sauces!) There are also things like Coney Island Hot Dogs on the menu. Fun for a night out for drinks and nosh, but not for those pining for true American cuisine.

KvwuGm-dF5D-tUomLFyC0A.text: The folks behind TFB really love their food + drink, and very much care about the customers' dining experiences. Always ask for cocktails not on the menu depending on your mood, and chat up the barman.

Sirf20iUZQ_b0Pa8m6nmDw.text: Great American food; ribs and burgers are highly reccomended.Quick, efficient and friendly serviceCocktails are fantastic!Tricky to find if you're not familiar with the area, but call for directions If in doubt. It's small and intimate so book in advance.

hAMGaYCQ4KqImSXAwaP-Wg.text: I was looking for somewhere central that I could take my dog and my parents on a Thursday night. I wanted it to be fun & very London as my parents live in Aberdeen & I don't get to see them that often. I noticed some chat about the Fat Bear so emailed to see whether they would accommodate my group. They were very helpful in making sure my dog would be welcome and made a reservation for us so that we would be sure to get a table.On arrival we were welcomed warmly and were well looked after all evening. I noticed that the warmness extended throughout the room, not just to us. Great customer service is my favourite so this was very good!We shared some deep fried pickles and pimento cheese to begin. Both were very good. In fact the deep fried pickles are the best I've tried in London - hot, great tang and didn't seem greasy at all, which is a feat to achieve when you're talking about fried food! The dip we got with it was some sort of ranch or mayo based affair - I can't remember what it was, but I would have preferred a blue cheese dip because I am mad about blue cheese. That's personal preference though, others might have preferred what was given. Both were reasonable sized portions for the price.For my main I wanted to have the spinach salad with a side of chicken wings, but unfortunately they were out of wings, BOOOOOOOOO. It's not a huge menu, so this was a little disappointing. Still, these things happen. The salad was really super delicious, and nicely southern. I approve. At the table we also had the burger with stilton cheese & sweet potato fries (a resounding YES) and the mac and cheese with bacon. All were happily devoured.The Sun & 13 Cantons seems to be a good choice for the Fat Bear's pop up restaurant. The pub is split into the pub side and the restaurant side, so really they can both get on with what they need to be doing. As it's a separately operating pop up, you do have to order your drinks at the bar yourself, but this isn't a problem - the bar staff were super friendly & efficient despite the bar being rammed on a Thursday night.We all had a very nice time here & enjoyed the food a lot. I will definitely return once they get a permanent spot and look forward to seeing what the service, atmosphere and food is like there. Maybe they will even earn that fifth yelpy star (the chicken wings being good might just seal the deal).Thanks FB!

g9tTO4tE8IyTLgaLs43Fzg.text: This is a pretty damn good restaurant, a proper representation of southern American cooking (not the cheap greasy stuff from fast food or the imitation 50s you get from 'diner' style restaurants).The staff are super friendly, the food tastes good and by god it's filling.We had starters and main, and the mains are the real stars of the show. (I'd suggest skipping the starters and saving room for the massive mains.)- Gator Bites where nothing special, sure you get the novelty or saying that you've eaten gater but the meat isn't particularly interesting and the pieces you get aren't hug.- Deep fried pickles were pretty fun but that's mostly because I love pickles anyway + the mayo was super tasty.- Grilled Red Snapper was very tasty, the sauce spicy and FULL of flavour. I can highly recommend it (though the fish was a little overdone on one side). Cajun spice is a win for me.- BBQ Brisket was absolutely brilliant. Full of flavour and just falling apart. The sauces were a delicious accompaniment, as were the very tasty slaw. My girlfriend couldn't finish the whole thing but that's ok because Fat Bear were more than happy to oblige us with a doggy bag (real U.S.A. style).I'm sure we'll go again, maybe with friends one time - it's a warm, comfort food experience.(My suggestion, make yourself a round of new Orleans milk punch at home after eating here, before you go to bed, delicious!)One thing to note is there isn't a massive variety of Veggy options, maybe 2 or 3, but if you have a high proportion of veggies with you, you probably shouldn't be taking them to a southern American restaurant.

K4J7puGHRrsNH6ELD21yNA.text: The food was overly expensive. One starter and one main cost 30 quid. The main, Seafood Ciopino, worth 18 pounds but no bigger than a starter. The seafood in the dish was negligible. Loads of sauce. Will not be eating here again. I am not sure what the other reviewers were eating.

zFgC5-nlmnW8JwBRGTJVHg.text: i'm slightly embarrassed that i sought out Southern American food, seeing as i live in the USA.  sometimes you just need a good fried chicken sandwich, and this place has one of the best.  the service is really friendly and efficient, and the food is top-notch.  i highly recommend a visit!

rEmF1vtRdC4oL-wpGfjOxw.text: I have been to the real New Orleans, and the Fat Bear still stands out with its exceptional soul food! The bartender also mixed up one of the best bourbon old fashioned's I've ever had. All-around wonderful experience. Great, affordable cuisine to share with friends over one of their signature cocktails. I little tough to find, but it's worth the journey!

WcYPMQogGtM2j9wue01wlA.text: Fried pickles was a new one for me.  This restaurant is an interesting cross between American and British restaurant concepts. The Southern country gentleman cocktail was inspired.  Sweet potato fries were fine, but not served with ketchup.  Gumbo was quite a better than I would've expected.  I has a fine meal

bpgDvmzOxw1BI-yuTXs1SA.text: I throughly enjoyed the food and the service. I came by myself as I was visiting on business. I sat at the bar and they immediately made me feel welcome. I ordered the spinach salad and cornbread. The waiter warned me the corn bread would be too much but he said I could eat it for breakfast!  Given that I am from the south in the USA I had to try the cornbread. It was so amazing as was the salad. The corn bread comes freshly baked, piping hot and oozing with corn and topped with honey.  It is to die for. May have to go back.

eKneqJYOowjbe4zGr2L3bw.text: Half of Fried pickles was cold (they must use frozen one) fried chicken was way over cooked and dry & hard to the level my jaw sore. Seafood Jambalaya was very nice but asparagus was again over cooked and cold by the time it was served. May not have a proper chef on weekend lunch?Friendly but... Avoid fried menu there.

bz7coUTtQP0BPtaZlUaCTg.text: American comfort food done right by the Brit's. Service was quick and friendly.  Highly recommend the Corn Bread. Best I've ever had and I've been to the south and mid-west.  Must try!

-jjwaYU1YVmbocZ9GImENQ.text: Good food nothing to say about that. BUT starter and main course were served warm/cold while it should be hot. Service was really friendly so was the person taking the reservation.

kwjAU99ltZeLFySfh5_5yg.text: Amazing food and great service. Try the bar recommendations, you won't be disappointed!

7wTInksnKoqA9w4Ez3s6qA.text: Had the pleasure of going to the Fat Bear last week, and can't wait to go back (the thought of some bacon mac and cheese and fried pickles is beginning to haunt my dreams...) We started with the pimiento cheese, which goes so well with a pint... and though I'm not a fan of onions I shocked even myself as I heaped larger and larger piles of it on crackers...followed that up with the crawfish popcorn, which were... well, little crispy bits of heaven, really. On to the biscuits and gravy which were a wonderfully savory english riff on the southern classic and the gumbo which had a good amount of spice that just warmed my American heart. Having recently moved over here from the states it was really a treat and just a great meal all around. I haven't seen too many places like this in London so far, and these guys are really doing it right.

KWDEG5TZ8SxpmJKZ6I9mwA.text: Stumbled upon this clubby place this afternoon for a late lunch. Love the room - like an old style US city restaurant, small and cosy. Nice wines and craft cocktails. Love the southern food menu. Had the chicken and waffles and they beat any we ever had in Atlanta. Will try and get back later this month. Staff was very friendly and knowledgable. Yum!

pQmBvzFHYsm7gJ9jQfU2vA.text: i left feeling like a fat bear and i am actually quite petite, great night and good food with friends  even if the majority is fried- yummy

2JfVBjFiS73SP74iMnzXmg.text: Hidden spot in a cozy side street.When we walked up the tiny stairs I already felt this will be something special.We made it up to the main floor and I wasn't disappointed. A very cozy place, amazing location for dinner. We reserved kind of an extra room for 15 people and did all fit around the huge table, perfectly. Our Pre- Thanksgiving Dinner was made with lots of love, I could tell.. Even though it was not my kind of meals (some things TOO salty, others just too spicy).Anyhow, the waiters were doing an great job and my glass of wine kept being full (whereas I kept wondering.. Didn't I down this already?!).So overall, loads of food - just not my personal taste- and amazing service.  Thanks Fat Bear!

CkuxMaF36I_umh15RTe1Ag.text: The Fat Bear is above the Rising Sun pub, with the entrance tucked into a little alley off Carter Lane. It's a nice, cosy restaurant with a lovely ambiance. We had a set menu, served family style, and the food was seemingly never-ending! There was a great variety of dishes to try, and although some were definitely better than others the food was very tasty. Although I hate to think how many calories I consumed!The service was also good, with the staff very friendly and helpfully explaining each dish to us as it was brought out.

J4s29qj_LuS8aFCrgDQKHQ.text: If you ever feel like you want to have real Thanksgiving in London, this is just the place!  Being in love with food, it always was my dream to experience this biggest food feast ever. And believe it or not, the Fat Bear reached my expectations to the core. Not just the quantity of the food which never seemed to stop and was impossible to eat, but also the quality.  Our tables were bending over with food, just as out bellies were aching from overreaching our limits. As for starters, we got very delicious cheese spread, even better rabbit liver and some nice spicy chicken wings with garlic sauce. All these were followed by turkey, cheese macaroni, grilled veggies, rice, fish, some ham, meat cake, sweet potatoes and by some other three different plates which I could not try any more.  And what it would be for a feast without a dessert. My winner was the Oreo cheesecake, however I strongly recommend also the warm pumpkin pie. All in one, the food was delicious, just as the service and very familiar atmosphere, just as it should be during Thanksgiving. Do not hesitate and try it out, but don´t be surprised if you stuff yourself way too much. I have warned you :)

0RlixRY9G59Lv-pLkdfsLg.text: My husband and I stumbled on this little gem while visiting London. The ambiance was perfect for unwinding and the cocktails were so pretty, I almost didn't want to drink it. I can't recall the name but it had a sliver of lemon and was absolutely AMAZING! The guys running the place looked smart and dapper and the conversation was lovely. The music selection was great and I would love to go back for a visit. I highly recommend this hidden gym to locals and tourists alike.

9qEFq6sT8G9AkP0KS2oo8w.text: We visited after a friend recommended us to and we were so happy they did. The menu had a great variety of foods which all sounded tasty and lucky enough our meals were! Friendly service, good food, what more can you ask for?

twOcbGT51s-0ihc_-mb6kA.text: My only advice to you is that you don't eat anything the entire day in preparation for your evening at the Fat Bear....If you've come here when they had the Bob's Lobster residency, you'll already be familiar with the location above the Rising Sun pub. This time around, it's all creole and the best things of southern American food you could think of that oddly aren't around many other places in London.Get: Truffled gnocchi, chicken fried steak, cornbread, corn on the cob, chicken waffles, mint juleps, spinach dip, more gnocchi and a magic carpet to carry you home because you won't be able to move. They also do events, so check their FB and Twitter feeds if you're into crawfish boils.

3Ff0ecYY-SNbSX6zH4Fv4w.text: I'm so glad I found this place. From the moment the I stepped.. the service was amazing. The gentleman couldnt have been more lovely and polite. The food was yummy. I had the gumbo. BUFFALO WINGS WERE TOO DIE FOR. Thr marinade was so lush and the blue cheese was divine. Cocktails were also yummy as we're the waffles and ice cream. Probable realised I'm a food fatty and tried to order everything.Would recommend 100%

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Bear - London, United Kingdom

PmomGE7ILSa0IjQ__RVmYA.text: Okay so... soul food in London.  Let's give this a go!The Fat Bear is a small, cozy place for eats above a pub.  It was the scene of our most recent book club, where there was far more discussion over food than books.  Walking into the Fat Bear, I wanted to try pretty much everything.  Fried pickles?  Yes please.  Fried chicken livers?  You don't say!  Chicken fried steak and chicken and waffles?  Check and Check!  Do I want poutine?  Heck yes I want poutine!Unfortunately, the Fat Bear was out of a few things we may have wanted to try.  Particularly the chicken and waffles which was a bit of a bummer.  And I can't recommend the cornbread because it was far too dense.  But everything else we ate was fantastic.  Or at least everything I ate.  Particularly the chicken livers which tasted of a far higher quality liver and the chicken fried steak which is somewhat of an upgrade to their southern American counterparts using ribeye steak instead of a standard pounded within an inch of its afterlife skirt steak (although don't get me wrong... my little Texan heart loves a crappy meat chicken fried steak).  The gravy on the CFS was amazing.  And that same gravy was on the poutine, also amazing.  And the service was also lovely and super tolerant of our loud book club behinds.I totally want to go back.

rhlIGuf9JKWmVXfvk2LP9A.text: I love love love this place. I came here visiting from Germany and it was my first time in London. My expectations were exceeded. Extremely kind staff. Food is really good and rich so come on an empty stomach. Drinks are really good as well. Must make sure you make reservations.

8fB8zkUMzZ4xgiFtqpOJbg.text: Having just come back from a long holiday around the US, I can safely say that this is the best American food I've eaten this side of the pond. It's not following the 'Americana' trend as many restaurants are - they're refining it using their British influence and the highest quality local produce. We tried the franks wings, mac and cheese with bacon, and fish tacos - all of which ere executed perfectly - particularly the mac and cheese which was the perfect combination of saucy and smokey. We will definitely return, and I'm very tempted by the £30 tasting menu - the best value tasting menu I've seen anywhere in London!Looking forward to the main site to open next year. ALL HAIL THE FAT BEAR!

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Bear - London, United Kingdom. Garlic butter baked oysters from a previous pop up. Hope to see these on the menu soon!
Photo of The Fat Bear - London, United Kingdom. Not a great photo but shows some of the delights! Also the menu rotates frequently which is a lovely surprise.
Photo of The Fat Bear - London, United Kingdom. Mouth-wateringly delicious mac 'n cheese with bacon

7mebHtY0fMwGabpgRSbi4A.text: This is one of those tough reviews because it's probably a solid 4.5 stars, so do I round up or round down? Given the really great customer service, I'm gonna round it up.We came here for book group one night. My choice as we were reading "The Commitments" and I made the soul music/soul food link in my head. First we started with a cocktail, and I was really happy with mine. Everyone else seemed impressed with theirs as well. I liked how they had a mix of sweet and not-too-sweet cocktails as I prefer mine on the not-too-sweet spectrum of things.We started with a bunch of nibbles to share. We had the buffalo wings, the fried pickles, the spinach dip and the fried liver to start. I really couldn't fault the starters. The wings were tasty and the blue cheese dip was awesome. They maybe weren't traditional, but that's okay! The fried pickles were awesome. And those fried livers were really the best thing. Soft and delicious.For the main course, I had the brisket, but only because the chicken and waffles wasn't available. We also split the poutine, corn bread and beans on the side. The poutine was freaking amazing. I don't know if it's traditional, but that gravy was outstanding. The beans were incredibly good as well. The corn bread was the only disappointment of the sides as it was really dense. It had nice flavor, but the texture was all wrong. The brisket was good for London, but didn't compare to places you can get it in the US. I did really love the mustard barbeque sauce it was served with though. Dessert we split the pie of the month, and there were two: coconut cream and peanut butter. I was happy with both. I even had a bit of someone's sundae, and it was spectacular. I took some of the praline home, and I enjoyed it, but my partner thought it was too sweet. All in all the food and atmosphere (and cocktails) are great, and I would go back in a heartbeat. Maybe next time I'll plan on brunch.

xyy8Y_2kegzDpdS2DnEZrQ.text: Brilliant hidden spot!  You really need to know where you're going to find this gem.  We had such a hard time deciding what to order because EVERYTHING looked fantastic!  We settled on the briscuit sandwich and the muffuletta sandwich.  Luckily i ordered the muffuletta as the half size because it was still huge!  The briscuit was yummy and juicy topped with yummy bbq sauce.  The muffuletta was fresh and full of flavor.  Chips were also great! Will go back! !!

MAKCe_iky6cN6SjCniV2TQ.text: Absolutely tasty!!! I actually found this joint here on yelp. It's really close to the cathedral, it's a little hidden but it's super cute and they have amazing food! My mom ordered the club sandwich, my dad a burger with shrimp and I ordered the southern chicken burger. Handsdown the best chicken burger I've ate in my life. Not even because I live in California have I ate a burger this delicious.

q-5DzNltL23iA04mOaBc3g.text: Best American cuisine in London. Probably the best in Europe. Their cocktails are dope, and the staff are a great bunch. The pleasant atmosphere and reasonably priced grub/booze are merely a bonus, as visiting this place is worth every penny.

ph8hw-5Som095QDP31UVGQ.text: Where do I start? Let's go with three words ......... Flavour town baby!!!! I mean literally! My friends and I decided to try this joint out and boi oh boi were we surprised! The staff are super duper friendly and food is just straight out delicious! You get American portions too which made me feel good about myself lol no idea why! But damn! Food this good should be prohibited! Now I know why they suffer from obesity over there! If the food is this flavoursome then I don't blame them! I'll be joining the team! Anyhoo so I had the softshell crab burger for mains and the buffalo wings for starters ......, let me just say those were the tastiest buffalo wings in history! Someone should give that chef a medal dammit! And the crab burger was another trip to flavour town! Had the cheese cake and the sundae for dessert coz I'm a greedy little poppet haha ..... Jesus Christ it was mind blowing!  That cheese cake!! I need it for my future wedding cake point final! And the sundae had my eyes at the back of my head! To say the least we had a ball! Go there now!! Stop reading this and go! It's soooooo worth it! Best american food in London

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Bear - London, United Kingdom. The fat bear sundae!!!!!!!
Photo of The Fat Bear - London, United Kingdom. The softshell crab burger that had me going crazy!!! In a good way

vHWJJmRMscrRtnqXVn7jLA.text: I have to confess that when I found out this place existed I was disappointed I hadn't found out about it earlier. The Fat Bear has taken a 1 year residence above the Rising Sun pub and I hope it stays longer.The menu is a mash up of US (and Canada) favourites - apparently the chef is a Canadian with New Orleans roots. And it shows. The appetisers are superb. We had them all - deep fried pickles, wings, gator bites. Sweet chilli sauce with the gator isn't traditional but works well. The mains were also good. We had the shrimpJambalaya which looks great, the Southern fried chicken burger and Southern Fried Chicken as a main were both great. The crispy batter is excellent - I added the poutine to my main and so glad I did. The Gravy is a smoky delight. So good! No room for dessert sadly. Next time. Cocktails were very original and excellently presented. And picklebacks have to be tried - only way I will drink whiskey now! Go here and enjoy. Food,drink, service are all great.

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Bear - London, United Kingdom. Southern Fried Chicken and Sweet Potato Fries
Photo of The Fat Bear - London, United Kingdom. Southern Fried Chicken Burger and Poutine
Photo of The Fat Bear - London, United Kingdom. Cocktail with a monkey banana garnish!

AWtKEY0gpphxDBjvQdwwUg.text: Delicious food, attentive service, cozy atmosphere. We ate dinner here our first night in London and can't wait to come back!

UnlW6U-FX6pZQ077UcOrww.text: Fantastic food, service and atmosphere. The dark lighting and relaxed atmosphere means time just flies by as you enjoy the authentic food and drinks. Very much looking forward to returning!

8SkfCz_8SWJoywZgImXLOg.text: Very good food, very good service. This is coming from an American. The burgers and garlic fries were exceptional, the fried pickles were unparalleled, and the chicken and waffles were superb.

Bogu4UKRmEGPe5T91dtyAQ.text: Very cute place!After reading another yelper's review, I thought I must visit. I had previously not heard of or seen any other places in London claiming to serve authentic Cajun or REAL chicken and waffles, so it was immediately bookmarked. Upon walking in, the decor has a very New Orleans, speakeasy type vibe. Very cute date night spot, nice place to grab drinks after work, or to have a meal with a group of friends. Very friendly staff- found out later that it's family owned and operated. The only reason I've only given 4 stars is they had no chicken and waffles or ribs!!! The two dishes we wanted to order were not available. Very disappointing. The buffalo wings were good. Nothing to write home about, but I'm a harsh critic with wings having lived in Atlanta for years where all the original wing spots exist. According to UK standards, they are quite good. Jambalaya- 5 stars. Very flavourful and the two tiger prawns on top add a nice touch. My friend had the Coney Island hotdog and for her that was just a bit much. The chilli was impressive, but I wouldn't recommend unless you were really craving a hot dog specifically that day. The cocktails- great! We had the bartender, Brian, bring over an original drink from New Orleans on the house once we got settled at our table. Very impressive, very strong, and indeed, very New Orleans. He also made a lovely mocktail for my preggo friend and the mint rose daiquiri was just as described. Very fresh, very flavourful, just delicious. And the presentation is fantastic. 5 full stars for the cocktails. We decided we'd save dessert for our next visit, which we definitely will do soon to experience the chicken and waffles. All in all, I'd highly recommend visiting. Definitely for a great cocktail, great food, and an overall nice evening out.

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Bear - London, United Kingdom. Jambalaya

wjJdqwrkJMMde28H8PFa3Q.text: Ooooooooh heaven is a place in Blackfriars. Dear god, since spending some time in Tennessee I have loved southern American food and the Fat Bear is nailing the awesomeness.Having been once with yelp to try the whole menu i recently returned with a friend for an off the cuff Friday night dinner.Wandering up the stairs from the pub below it still amazes me the cute surroundings of this speak easy styled restaurant. Welcomed by the manager despite being busy they found space for us at the bar.Beers ordered we looked over the menu. We were stuck with what to eat.....ribs, alligator bites, crab burger......chicken fried steak (I'll explain later).....it was a really tough call.The offer of being allowed ribs as a starter made life easier. Shared ribs, followed by the soft shell crab burger for me and the chicken fried steak (CFS) for my friend. Ribs.....dear god. That's all I have to say about that.What is CFS, well let me tell you my friend....they take a lovely ribeye steak....they tenderise it and they prepare it like they would feed fried chicken and serve it with their house gravy. OMFG.......this is heaven on a plateMy giant crab was juicy and amazing and awesome, on a fresh roll it was also epically good. Happy JD.All washed down with a couple of pickle backs this was a night to remember. I will be back......soon.....it's lunchtime soon....I might be back today.

Mar9EvpzRv7-fpPHLyiw4Q.text: It's my first time in London! my family and I went here on a break from our tour! Super fast and taste amazing. Nice waitress. Great ambiance and pretty cool that you have to go upstairs to get to it.

1voPmiKGWEj07-cLpkLmkQ.text: Excellent choice! The menu is simple but great - I had the chicken and waffles and Oreo cheesecake, and it was delicious! Not terribly expensive, either.  Very nice location (cozy English feel, second story) and good service. I would definitely come back here.

Z4OmMg0158h7sRPUBf8uRw.text: First time here. Great food great atmosphere and I love that it's hidden and tucked away in central London. Service was great!I'll be coming back!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Bear - London, United Kingdom. Braised short rib
Photo of The Fat Bear - London, United Kingdom. Chicken and waffles
Photo of The Fat Bear - London, United Kingdom. Country steak

4vL6-xNOzKt1FO8-EHJNLw.text: I took my boyfriend here for his birthday last Saturday, I wanted to try this place since I saw the pictures of their food here on yelp, and seeing as the boyfriend loves hearty food (and has a thing for bears) I thought it was the perfect chance.I had a lot of expectations for this place and I'm very very glad to say: boy, did it deliver.It's a bit tricky to spot if you don't know where it is but somehow it was full 10 minutes after we've arrived (we had booked for 6:30pm so still quite early). Considering how desolated the area is, this really speaks volume. The room has a cosy and intimate atmosphere to it. The blinds were shut and it was candle lit. We ordered a variety of starters, which included potato gnocchi in blue cheese sauce (my sweet god), deep-fried gator bites (holy moly) and deep-fried pickles (drooling all over my keyboard as I type). We were blown away by the flavours.We couldn't set on just two mains as we wanted to try many many things, so we ordered pork ribs, beef brisket and the soft shell crab burger. The brisket was quite a bit tough to be honest, but everything else was absolutely delicious. My boyfriend said he never had better pork ribs in his entire life. All mains came with fries, but we also ordered poutine which I had tried once in Canada and wanted to try again (it was PERFECT) and beer-battered onion rings (which DID NOT crumble into pieces when you touched them, as pub-food ones usually do).We finished it off with a flaming bear and a shortcake strawberry cheescake for dessert. As well as a couple of cocktails. The staff is extremely kind, knowledgeable and efficient, as well as a pleasure to interact with. They offered a killer double shot at the end of the meal as a happy birthday homage. The other half described The Fat Bear as 'twenty square feet of bloody perfection' and I couldn't agree more. Next time we'll be trying their brunch. Couldn't recommend this place enough. We paid quite a bit of money but we ordered A LOT of food, and it was worth every penny.

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Bear - London, United Kingdom. Potato gnocchi, gator bites and deep fried pickles
Photo of The Fat Bear - London, United Kingdom. Soft shell crab burger
Photo of The Fat Bear - London, United Kingdom

TTN3v7Xm9OKsyJIHyV6MDg.text: My partner and I are Texas natives. We love London, having moved here last August, but missed the food dearly. Fat Bear satisfies that need though with southern style food that is every bit as good as that from one of our favorite restaurants in Dallas. I am afraid I can't recall the names, but we have had numerous different cocktails, and they have all been excellent. We usually start with the fried pickles, which are quite good. For mains, my partner always gets the country fried steak while I have experimented a bit more. I think the buffalo chicken sandwich will be my new go to. We also always get the Mac and cheese on the side. It has a real nice spice to it. The service here is also excellent. The last time in as easily the best service we have seen in London. They are attentive without being evasive.

s-Dtne5knspqlSr5y4Eb1Q.text: RARR RAAARRR RAR RAAAR R RAAAAAAAAARRRRRRR!!Oh sorry... I'll switch from Bearlish to English for the sake of this review.What I was trying to say was, "Come as a normal human, leave as a fat bear!"That's the best way that I can explain coming to this bingerie. First of all... finding this place, even with City Mapper, is like trying to find a piece of bear poo in a forrest. Just remember it's in a side alley off of the street address so keep looking and you will be rewarded like a Bear King! RAAARRR! Back to English...Let's see what I binged on:Fried pickles (yummy! but could use more chunky pieces)Collard Greens - MMMM!!! Taste like I'm in Mississippi!Sweet Potato Fries (This was more like SP chunks and damn good chunks)Mac 'n Cheese (More cheese than Mac making it stew-ish, but you will never hear me complain about more cheese!)Chicken and Shrimp Gumbo (My gums and the teeth attached to them were pleased with this dish!! More refined than the typical Louisanna-style, but still Gumby!... errr.. I mean Yummy....)Catfish - CATFISH! I haven't even seen that on a menu since I left the US! I was super happy to have this huge fried slab of c-fish on a plate in front of me and you better believe it didn't stand a CHANCE again me!! RAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAARRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRR!Oreo Cheesecake (one more time.... oreo..... cheesecake... I need not say more)In the end little half-asian 61.3Kg Dennis the human left this bingerie as 85Kg+ Dennis the fat grizzly bear.Raaaaar ra ra raaa raaaaaaaar r rrar rrrrrra RAAAAAAAAAARRR!! (Looking for some Southern American cuisine sure to leave your belly 185% full? This is the place for YOU!)

1UUxYdVLiwscSNi1oWC2hA.text: Great little restaurant above a trending bar. Really good food with very friendly staff! Enjoyable and recommendable!

U--nDLHDMX9dbE7J_thYig.text: Went to The Fat Bear on our first night in London and man am I happy we did.Five stars from all aspects: staff were incredibly friendly, and made awesome suggestions for food and drink (they even let a friend of mine take a photo with the bartender behind the bar), music was spot on (they have a Spotify playlist you can follow!, I believe it's "thefatbearuk"), and our meals were out of this world.My two friends both got the chicken and waffles which they enjoyed, and I got the ahi tuna salad (DELICIOUS). Good portion sizes for the price point. TRY A PICKLEBACK. Just do it. Not nearly as gross as it sounds.Whenever I return to London, The Fat Bear will be sure to be one of my stops.

NNBswoYIq0QtYSEH89O8Zg.text: There is a reason I'm choosing The Fat Bear as my first review.I visited this cosy restaurant tucked away in the side streets near Blackfriars a few months ago- however, unfortunately, I didn't have Yelp at the time so all my raving was limited to my friends and family.Thankfully, for my friends sake, I now have Yelp - so I can finally leave the review that this place really deserved.A sensible place to start will be with the food. AMAZING. WHOLESOME. HEARTY. DELICIOUS. All these are words that fall short of describing just how good the food was. Every course, from the corn dogs and hot wings starter, through the short rib and game gumbo main to the Oreo cheesecake and apple pie dessert was packed full of soul. In fact, the only way it could have got any more soulful would be if James Brown shuffled out with the food himself, belting out "Soul Man" at the top of his voice.The fact that I can not only remember what I had several months later, but that it still leaves my mouth watering just thinking about it really is testament to the quality of the food experience I had there. Now, I must confess something. I was with my girlfriend (I couldn't possibly have eaten all of the above myself) and I remember the overwhelming food envy and consuming jealousy I felt when her short rib came out - a huge single rib of tender, meaty goodness what can only have come from some kind of super-cow. I remember that sinking feeling of regret that I, fool that I was, had ordered the game gumbo instead. But this feeling didn't last for long. One forkful of gumbo in and all my fears were washed away by the explosion of meaty, spicy flavour. It didn't matter that it was a typical rainy windy day outside. I could close my eyes and find myself in the warm sun of the deep south. Okay, that's enough about the food. Next stop, atmosphere.Being faced with the busy boozer at street level, and the well-worn stairs to take you up to the Fat Bear, you might be forgiven for having second thoughts. But don't. What greets you at the top is a positively charming, cosy and friendly dining room. It's not a big place, but that only adds to the intimacy and really makes it feel like you've found somewhere quite special. I felt like this was my own secret discovery (despite the rest of the tables being full of happy eaters) and that I'd really nailed it with this choice of date spot.The music is an excellent, eclectic choice and suits the vibe of the place. The staff are excellent and very attentive - their care and passion for the place is really infectious. Ask about their cocktails, try them and whatever you do don't leave this place without a pickle back or two.I couldn't recommend The Fat Bear highly enough. I can't wait to return shortly to try some of the new menu items - although please don't all go at once because I need a table!

O5mavCfA_bvNfEPqwHv2gQ.text: After a full day at Tate Modern, my husband and I were craving to have a hearty dinner. We decided tocross the river and wander around St. Paul. Best decision because we stumbled upon this cozy restaurant.What initially attracted us was the noise. On a small side street, people were spilling out from a pub, all seemingly ecstatic that it was finally a Friday night! As we drew nearer, we saw a stairway that led to a second floor with the restaurant's sign. A quick search on Yelp revealed that it was a highly rated place!So off we went and immediately loved the dim lighting and small space. That delightful British accent filled the area and that's always a delightful thing.By the way, this isn't an English pub, but a Creole-inspired restaurant. Think: gumbo and barbecue shrimps and lots of spice! YUMMMMM.We got the spinach dip which was such a good starter. Fresh, chunky. And for mains, my husband got the mushroom and biscuits. I got the barbecue shrimp and biscuits. Everything was a hit!! Everything was so hearty and flavorful and perfectly warmed our tummies on a cold winter night. Wish we could've gotten dessert too but we were so tired from the long day that after such a meal, all we wanted to do was crawl under the comforter!Five stars indeed!

2ISqcSjpCROOoY2pvG-_xw.text: This was our first trip to London and the first restaurant we tried, as it was close to where we were staying and had good reviews on here. Man I'm glad we came! The service was excellent, everyone was very warm and welcoming. It was also off this nice, little alley and the restaurant had a lot of charm. The food was amazing! I had the mac and cheese and my fiancé had one of the burgers (which both sound simple enough) but they were soooo good, not your average burger and mac and cheese. We were too full before dessert so we didn't have anything but I regret not trying the Oreo cheesecake - I'm sure it would have been fantastic!

zZkuFbbG85NwiDxvHSVJsw.text: I picked this place because I knew my kids would like the chicken tenders and mac and cheese. But it's so much more refined than that. The food is a great representation of southern comfort food. The buffalo wings are as good as you will find in the USA, but enhanced because the blue cheese is actually real blue cheese. The pimento cheese is legit, creamy and delicious. We also had the gumbo, which was very tasty. The jambalaya was good although lacked in spice. The mac and pimento cheese was as good a mac and cheese as I've ever had. The chicken sandwiches got thumbs up from our kids. The owner was very attentive and the service was great. I would highly recommend.

xNgcQn_heF0YHz7EO6y0yA.text: Fried chicken and waffles! Soft shell crab burgers! Crayfish rolls! Fish cakes! Jumbalya! And pickle backs! This place has many of the American classics with a modern twist. Their cocktails are excellent and their wine list is great too. I'm not a big fan of American food and don't eat a huge amount of meat but if you are/do then this is definitely worth a visit. Some of the sauces were a little on the sweeter side for me but the flavours all work well together. Standout dishes, for me, were definitely the chicken livers (don't fear the offal!), the boneless beef short rib (wow) and the crayfish roll. But most of all the tuna salad was so fresh and delicious. And I have already decided that when I come back here I'm definitely getting a martini and fried pickles on the side. If you're a sweet tooth definitely leave room for dessert. And get a couple to share so you can try as many as possible.Space wise, there's a great table off the side for a bigger group and then lots of smaller places. They haven't tried to theme the place too usa- aka you wouldn't think that it's American food by the decor. That's a good thing. Feels a little bit like someone's dining room at home. With a very well stocked spirits collection. Great staff who know their booze and can help you if you're unsure what to chose. And just generally friendly and good for a chat. Check it out!

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Bear - London, United Kingdom. Chicken and waffles
Photo of The Fat Bear - London, United Kingdom. Pickleback. What is it? A liquid hamburger that's what. Order it.
Photo of The Fat Bear - London, United Kingdom

Mit6ja2cuWqUlhkcwfHgPw.text: Excellent must go restaurant. A modern twist on American dishes. Cannot recommend enough. I know some items look super American but they are so well done and high quality I believe anyone would enjoy. This is especially comforting for Americans living in London. It's also in a really fun areas. Great beer choices and adorable atmosphere. Go!

3SF8ppi6NUBl_WnFbgEciA.text: By far the best food we had in London, maybe all of Europe. We loved it so much the 1st night that we came back the very next night. The sauces are top notch. Burgers are tasty, fresh, and perfectly cooked. The pimento cheese is absolutely a must, on a burger or mac and cheese or just crackers. Chicken and waffles were terrific, the honey mustard maple syrup sauce was a perfect mate for this dish. The house recipe drinks are delicious, especially the Bear House Punch. The restaurant is small, cozy, and inviting. The waiter and bartender were so friendly, patient, helpful, and kind. They made our family of seven feel very welcome. I would consider another London trip specifically just to eat here again.

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Bear - London, United Kingdom. The bar.
Photo of The Fat Bear - London, United Kingdom. Juicy lucy and beef rib.
Photo of The Fat Bear - London, United Kingdom. Pickleback!

hBH1CcnZIjWZsPgGhmjdwQ.text: A corner of New Orleans in central London - Creole soul food doesn't get more real than this. Try their gumbos and corn dogs, both spicy, filling dishes that'll go perfectly with their impressive selection of drinks. Their Oreo cheesecake is equally indulgent and lovely. 5 stars!

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Bear - London, United Kingdom

aTCNG75dKndfRD25ctphbQ.text: Superb. Great host great atmosphere and most of all, great food. Had the pickleback which was very interesting way to have a shot. Beef rib tacos were served warm and had great flavor with a kick of spice, main was the cioppino, one of the best seafood dishes I ever had, everything was perfectly cooked. Finished off with a marvelous Oreo cheesecake. Will definitely be back when I'm in London

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Bear - London, United Kingdom. Entrance
Photo of The Fat Bear - London, United Kingdom. Bar and dining area
Photo of The Fat Bear - London, United Kingdom. Cioppino

jgB3uaexoZgXY2H4IYAxAA.text: I was really impressed and happy with my experience at the Fat Bear! After searching Yelp for the perfect place to take my husband on a date, I found the Fat Bear. I was initially attracted based on the reviews and food offered (American soul food). Plus everyone at my work highly recommended the restaurant.I was very impressed with the decor. It has a romantic cozy atmosphere while still retaining a laid back vibe. My husband doesnt particularly like fancy restaurants and the Fat Bear perfectly straddled the line between very nice and too swanky. The candle lit ambience was very nice in the small venue. The music choice was interesting without being too loud to hinder conversation. Overall, it was perfect.Despite being a Saturday night, the venue wasn't slammed. There was only one waiter and one bartender working, but they still ensured that all tables were looked after. The waiter was very attentive and had an American quality customer service, which was greatly appreciated.The food was probably the highlight of the evening! My husband had the slow rib, which he said was maybe the best thing he had ever eaten. The food had a subtle spice with a smokey flavor. They even had real maple syrup on the desert waffles! It was very good food and we left feeling very full. In fact, I felt full far into the next day! I was very happy with our evening here as it was exactly what I was looking for! Thank you Fat Bear for making our evening very special!

FPa-XrWMBezqj1QXMG5rsA.text: Wow wow wowAs a first timer to London this establishment was recommended to usAmazingThe food was exquisite!!!I had such an amazing time Thank you Debra and staff for making us all feel like one of the locals And Debra...maybe that's not even your name but I hope you remember who we are so you know we appreciate you!!!

5jy4PRWf6N4qLnJx5eEd4Q.text: The Fat Bear is a funky, fabulous find. Situated a stone's throw from St Paul's Cathedral above a pub, the small dining room feels intimate without being cramped.The staff are friendly, and willing to help - my dining partner has dairy allergies, and our server was more than happy to go talk to the chef to get recommendations on what would suit her.Drinks are good - a fantastic selection of spirits and cocktails. We didn't look at the wine list, but if beer is what floats your boat, then they have a choice of Brew Dog Kingpin Lager or Punk IPA - both excellent beverages. The server brought iced water to the table without being asked as well, which was a pleasant surprise.Food though is what this place is all about. They specialise in American soul food, and the menu left me drooling and struggling to choose. In the end, I selected the gumbo, which was superb - very tasty, full of generous amounts of sausage, chicken and prawn, with a nice, gentle spice level (no need for copious amounts of milk or iced water to soothe the burn!) with a side of cornbread. The cornbread is baked to order, so takes around 15 minutes, but was delicious and worth the wait. I also plumped for the fried pickles, which was a portion big enough for at least two, but still nicely moist in the centre (i.e. not deep-fried to oblivion).My dining partner went for the brisket, which was also a generous portion, and very tasty, just falling apart.The bill overall was very reasonable - just over £30 each including a gin and tonic each, so quite reasonable for Central London. All in all, an excellent dining experience, and one I hope to repeat in the future - I have my eye firmly on the jambalaya next time!

wwIhkG5rRsMe-_Qhhnlqaw.text: Also put on my radar by Yelp - I couldn't stand another room service menu, and ventured out looking for a dinner for one. Up the stairs, wasn't sure what to expect - a lovely surprise - cosy little place, with just enough style to feel like a quaint dinner experience. Well placed as a single diner in the adjacent room - nice vibe, but not in the main traffic. Great recommendations from the server on the dinner options - I had the gumbo - MAJOR YUM! But I'm sure the fried chicken & waffles, or beef short ribs would have been equally good. Other diners had the hamburgers - looked delicious. I ended with a key lime pie - just lovely. My only shock was the wine per glass price at 11 pounds for 175 mls. Great attentive service - wish I had discovered the place sooner!

ju-kQSgapO1F73KBWItpVQ.text: This spot had been on my to-go list for quite a while as I'm both a fan of Americana and also comfort food. I was therefore quite disappointed to see the veggie options were very limited. Normally this wouldn't faze me, as I'm pretty easy-going, but here the one option just didn't hit the spot for me. I did have the cherry wine which was glorious, and I ended up ordering just sides (amazing corn bread) and garlic fries (not very flavourful). I wish I'd liked this place more - the staff were kind and eccentric, the area a little hidden-gem-like, but I won't return, I'm afraid..

8LS42JHPXoBU8gZVDO683w.text: Was very interested in eating here but the experience was lackluster for me and not good for my husband.  Both the catfish and shrimp skewer apps were overcooked and dry.  The fries were good. While the wings had a tasty hot sweet sauce on them there was just too much sauce. Yuck. What a mess, and I am a woman who never shys away from a mess. My husband's Short Rib dinner was not enjoyable.  It was a poor cut of meat - mostly cartilage - and the meat needed a steak knife to cut it was so tough.  It should have fallen of with a fork.  The cocktails were good but the one we initially wanted were not available as they were out or primary ingredients.  We did not order dessert. Overall, it wasn't  worth my money.  The fish and meats were poor quality and they depended on heavy spicing or saucing to compensate for the lack of quality.

2ZRl6Q1wANTds7Dr2aTgqw.text: Amazing Southern food, the best cocktails of my life, and the friendliest of service? Fat Bear, you are my spirit animal.I kicked the night off with a Sazarac and the chicken and waffles. The Sazarac was strong but offset with the perfect amount of sweetness, making it a perfect partner for the entree I ordered. The chicken was perfectly crispy and tender, with just a touch of heat in the syrup that accompanies it.  From there, I decided on a dessert of Oreo cheesecake, and matched it to the Little Country Gentleman, a drink made with rye whiskey, root beer, sherry, amaro, and bitters.  Awesome! I was ready to pay and leave when I decided to have one more drink. This time I decided to make it bartenders choice, as clearly they knew what they were doing. Ryan, who is an expert mixologist, took great care in making me one of his favorite drinks: Remember the Maine. He gave me a history of the drink and its creator (Charles H. Baker), along with a full rundown of what I was drinking: essentially a Manhattan without bitters, with a hint of absinthe and a taste of cherry. So good.  I decided it was time to go before I got myself in trouble. But I will be back. You've gotta come here. Totally worth the trip!

iehXjjc8qFVx93YiNgD6jQ.text: Chicken and waffles are amazing. Great small atmosphere and the music overlay is excellent. The glazed ham is also incredible and if you are super hungry Spring for the starter gumbo and you won't be disappointed.

sXv1rhV0zMmXLEalpSL61w.text: Oh, what a night! Jurgen and Beth had organised a smallish yelper get-together and it was a treat! It's a little hard to find as it's upstairs above a pub. But once you find it, it feels really cozy and welcoming. We had a set menu that was served family style. There was just SO MUCH food. And while some dishes were definitely stronger than others, the variety alone made for a fantastic meal.I do wonder though, why do British restaurants insist on putting crumbly topping on mac and cheese? Not enough cheese, too much crumbly distractions. The staff was great, there were great dishes (and some okay ones) and fantastic company! What more could one ask for!

QeDMgXrUbF9N0Se9k4CexA.text: I try to search for good BBQ wherever in the world so I sought out the Fat Bear. Its is a block away from St Pauls Cathedral on a sidestreet. The area that it is in seemed to have alot of small bars that spilled out into the street. You have to walk up a set of stairs to get to the very small and dimly lit dining room. We had a reservation as is the norm in Europe. I found the food to be average. I found the food to be no better than a normal restaurant. The mac and cheese was very overpriced and not worth more than 5 dollars. Overall if you want some BBQ in a cool hip area and you are in the area stop by. But I would not make a out of your way trip for this restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Bear - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Fat Bear - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Fat Bear - London, United Kingdom

ryLFDeAS7lOwSlgO9DbLCA.text: Considering all the great reviews I'd read about this restaurant, I wasn't blown away.Everything was nice, but nothing about my Fat Bear made me feel that it set it apart. I ordered fried chicken and waffles which both individually tasted good, but not actually that complementary as a dish. I wasn't a huge fan of my cocktail, however, having said that, I do have to say that the barman was really accommodating and edited the cocktail to try and suit my taste buds so whilst I wasn't overly happy with the end result, the effort was there!In fact, the service overall was good, but they were almost a little too attentive by asking how the food/drinks were as soon as the fork made its first landing back to the plate. At times, it almost felt like our conversation was being eavesdropped by the other waiters to be honest...The actual space is a cute size with intimate, dim lighting and has a speakeasy vibe to it, so, if anything, it'd probably be better for a date night than a gathering with a large group of friends.

0A3PysdhEscpFFbFnKYtkA.text: The best craft cocktails I've had in a long time. Great service. I had the gumbo. The andouille sausage in the gumbo is specially made for them and is spectacular - Smoky and spicy, but not overpowering. They say the use this sausage in their corn dog app. I am definitely coming back here again. The Fat Bear is a real treat. A great experience.

qXpwMn5ep1Mczd9DmSJtEQ.text: Found this place on Yelp,  and was amazing and surprises how good it was :) Mixing the greatness of British food with a blend of American. We even had two Americans at the table to verify ;) At first it's slightly hard to find as it's upstairs if an old school British pub. As a result,  it's very secluded and quiet (this place should be far busier). I had the chicken with waffles. Really delicious and tender. And there were list was impressive. The staff were amazing,  friendly and helpful. I would completely recommend this place to almost all occasions :)

xw6jTnPlhNXaWEAiAVTQIQ.text: My oh my, what a night, what a meal, what a place!The Fat Bear is definitely a wonder of a hidden spot, located just round the corner from St.Pauls, above the Rising Sun.We walked up the slightly unusual staircase and found ourselves in a quaint wooden filled restaurant that mimicked the feel and atmosphere of a dining room. The room is lit by low lighting and candle light and the feeling of home and comfort is undeniable.The service throughout the evening was fantastic -the team were very friendly, informative and literally couldn't do enough for you.Now, to the food! We were a large group of 15 and pre-ordered from their menu which was thanksgiving themed. The restaurant itself is American inspired soul food so I had high exceptions from the start. Plate after plate, the food just kept on coming!The personal highlights for me were: Starter: The potted game served with caramelised onion and bread - this was just to die for. So flavoursome and rich, just a beautiful dish.Main: the turkey legs were cooked to perfection and the trimmings complimented eachother well. The stand out for me was the seafood gumbo - it certainly packed a punch but the seafood within was meaty and the scallops on top were a nice lil added bonus!Dessert: Oreo cheesecake - need I say more?! Creamy with a crunchy biscuit base. Perfectly made and it went down a treat! This place really did tick all the boxes for me and I'll definitely be heading back for some more once I've digested these meal which I feel may take a while.

Photo of The Fat Bear - London, United Kingdom. Family gathering
Photo of The Fat Bear - London, United Kingdom. Oreo cheesecake

hTHrkVdFp5IRogG94YNJeQ.text: You need to look for the entrance (it's upstairs a pub) but your reward is your dinner.We got to try most of the menu and it was yummy. Hands up for the chicken, that was moist and tender and full of flavour. (try the buttermilk southern fried chicken).For you mac&cheese lover, not only do they serve very creamy jalapenos mac&cheese they also serve a lobster version. If I had to choose between the two...well I wouldn't, I'll pick both.Now to the desert, oreo cheesecake was to die for. I wasn't hungry anymore, swear I couldn't eat any more, but I ate my entire slice. Service was really good and I love their outfits (they have something similar to a singing quartet with brace and tie, loved it)

V_rLQqEmVXKnamlemsOGig.text: My first Thanksgiving was always going to be a big deal but the Fat Bear made it a special and memorable experience. Myself and some friends visited last night for what can only be described as a three course feast. Highlights of the meal for me included the turkey and stuffing, sweet potato mash and the mac&cheese. They were all were perfectly prepared and presented well. The only downside of this meal was the huge amount of food I consumed but when it's this good how can you resist....Fat Bear team...take a bow.

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Bear - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Fat Bear - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Fat Bear - London, United Kingdom

ETFIu_v0nFPrvrcGC1QL_A.text: A bit expensive (like most decent places in the area) but very good food - based on the chicken wings and beef rib. Also nice wine, for all I know about that. Not the sort of place you'll just stumble into, it's upstairs over a pub. Was a bit nervous about that but needn't have been. Would happily return.

TlX1GYvw2BtUsgxzZy0ujw.text: To be accurate, I would give The Fat Bear a 4.5 but for some reason Yelp hasn't yet allowed us to give half stars! The reason I don't hesitate to round up is because 4 stars just wouldn't do this place justice.We came here on a Saturday at 7, it was empty when we walked in but was quickly filling in as we ate. It's situated above a pub right around the corner from St. Paul's Cathedral. The restaurant itself looks like it was set up in someone's apartment, but it kind of works. It adds to the quaint feel of th restaurant.The service was absolutely outstanding. Beyond being extremely polite, you can tell they really care about their food and drink. Something to definitely be appreciated.I would highly recommend the pimento cheese with tortilla chips and the buffalo wings. Both were ridiculously good! The boneless beef rib was good, but a little tough for my liking, although the sauces that came with it were amazing! We also ordered the disco fries but I will probably skip that next time and try something else.If you're looking for a different American-style meal, come here!

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Bear - London, United Kingdom. Chicken fried steak... delicious but a smidge too salty
Photo of The Fat Bear - London, United Kingdom. Buffalo wings! So good
Photo of The Fat Bear - London, United Kingdom. Disco fries with gravy and cheese

2pZlWob2j46W_J7dJPvBzg.text: Great food, great staff!!! The only problem my family and I had was finding the restaurant--we walked up and down the block but didn't think to turn into the black (if that makes sense). We got the restaurant basically at opening time (6pm) and had the place to ourselves for most of our meal.

CT6--Xk234O0oJCOYw0IKg.text: Loosen your belts people! And starve yourself all morning in preparation! This place served up the most calorific but also tastiest plate of food I've had in ages.We came here for a Friday team lunch so had a long table for 9 and essentially took over the back room. It's well tucked away above the Rising Sun pub with little to give away what sits upstairs, so you really have to know it's there. We booked for midday so were practically the first to arrive and our server greeted us warmly.She settled us in for a hearty (though probably not so good for your heart) feast. We shared starters of Gator Bites which I loved, in panko breadcrumb with a moreish sweet chilli dip, and some poutine just because one of the girls hadn't tried it. The mains could probably start an obesity epidemic but cover some good old-fashioned southern classics with gumbo, chicken & waffles, burgers and ribs. I couldn't resist trying the Chicken Fried Steak out of curiosity and promptly made everyone jealous when it arrived - it was probably the largest main course portion at the table! I got particular green eyes from my foodie colleague who went for the jambalaya and got quite a small pot. The clue is in the name - it is indeed a rib-eye steak deep fried in buttermilk and seasoned flour, and like nothing I've tried before. The taste was amazing - combining the best parts of eating fried chicken with the fun of eating steak underneath. There were a few overly fatty bits I left behind but otherwise I was very happy with it, served with a peppery gravy and some pleasingly skinny fries. I definitely felt a bit like a fat bear after that. The decor is very white-walls-wooden-tables plain, but then it's a limited residency so understandable. The service was very attentive too, in fact almost overly so - it was actually quite annoying to start with as she kept coming over, adjusting one thing (e.g. straightening a fork or filling one water glass), then walking away only to return 20 seconds later and repeat. But I think she stopped coming on so strong once the place filled up, and she was happy to chat about some of the things on the menu we had questions about.Food comas ensued for most of the afternoon back at the office, so beware if you choose it for lunch. It's open all day though so you could probably make better use of the drinks menu in the evening, and think it works well for couples and groups alike as long as you book ahead. The best part is it's pretty good value for what you get, and I'd definitely go back - but one to take a break between visits methinks!

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Bear - London, United Kingdom. fat lunch - chicken fried steak!

PnCjrM2XWUZTeEqxXnDaUA.text: Hmm...I guess I'm spoiled when it comes to southern/bbq style food. First thing first - I hope you guys received your Argos order (aka fans). On a hot summer night, with no air circulation whatsoever, we kept chugging water with lots of ice to cool ourselves down. Then we proceeded with ordering wings (tiny), tacos, a few other stuff that I can't seem to recall and drinks. Dear reader, have you ever seen this video on instagram or your facebook feed, where chefs prepare little burritos for little hamsters? Those burritos and little guys were really cute, right? Well we got those burritos, unfolded, served as tacos. I felt the rage when I stared at my tacos and decided to drink my misery..wait, what? I got a margarita that is literally a sample size drink but charged fully. Come on now, tequila, lime and agave syrup are no expensive ingredients and ice is a really, really important part of this drink. Especially when you do not have an AC in your restaurant and all your windows are closed. We will probably not be back.

2glk1suASG9SZGoU69HvMw.text: We loved this place. The chicken and waffles with jalapeño maple syrup was simply delicious. My son said the deviled eggs were better than mine - and I am truly a Deep South girl who makes them frequently. The 1932 cosmopolitan was perfectly crafted. Will recommend to my friends visiting the U.K. later this summer.

W0zfYFaQN9uumxaVqhCJaQ.text: I felt a bit like a genius because I was choosing a place for several friends to meet up and we all wanted different things. I wanted something with at least one good veggie option, they wanted something with meat, and it had to be somewhere in-between Camden and Canary Wharf, not too pricey, and ideally close to the city because otherwise our Italian friend probably wouldn't make it. And lo and behold.... THE FAT BEAR!!! It was all we wanted and more! This place is sort of tucked away and up some stairs above a pub. It's really just a room and a half, which makes it super cozy and they have a pretty awesome looking bar. It's got warm lighting which makes the atmosphere really nice. Their cocktails were delightful and the service was excellent. I will make a very strange observation that someone working there had a very drunk friend who just sort of made herself at home. Then more joined and it turned into me watching this table of really really drunk people trying to order food. Two of them ended up just falling asleep. It was super strange. Anyway, me being distracted aside, I really loved the cocktail I ordered- Sloe Boat To China, and everyone else seemed happy with theirs. I was dying to try the pimiento cheese starter and the fried pickles. The cheese was particularly sharp and delicious. The pickles were good, but quite skinny (I mean come on, you're in an American restaurant I was expecting some serious pickles). The vegan gumbo was super spicy and delicious. I was impressed and enjoyed it. My husband dropped the ball and ordered the regular jambalaya (with sausage) rather than the seafood one which broke my heart a little bit, because I really wanted to try it. You know, I guess that means we'll just have to come back. Oh also another bonus, this place has brisket which is really hard to find. I can't say how it tastes but my friend said he defo approves (am I becoming more British with these words, or just more annoying?)Anyway, to finish it off I had the oreo cheesecake which the bomb. I love oreos. And it tasted like oreo. So all was right with the world. A wonderful place to come if you have people who want to try American food, or if you have out of town Americans who are too scared to try other food, or if you have hungry friends that want to try cajun food, or if you just want to try some really yummy food.

TnOY5dTI-oHZ0Ul8MDtJ6A.text: Great food, great atmosphere, very friendly service! This is truly a gem that can be found just off the beaten path.

f8YrJTF6VLBd0JLNY7AUSQ.text: I finally made it here!! I think it's been on my bookmarks for YEARS. It did not disappoint- fantastic fried chicken and really good cornbread. Definitely get those.It's the perfect place for comfort food/for a cold day.I also was pleasantly surprised with the interior it was dimly lit and had really good ambiance.Next I want to try their mac and cheese!

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Bear - London, United Kingdom

ETjXXVbVJrLxxYrDQZXymw.text: Great food, first time going there it was a little tricky to find. On Google it gives the address but on their website they tell you exactly where it is. It's above another place called the rising sun pub. A little  annoying they close early. We had to be there no later than 9.15pm as the kitchen closes 9.30pm. Would have been a bit nice for more eye contact from waiters and provided a knife and fork to eat without asking. Starters were great the chicken on our main was cooked to perfection wonderfully crispy on the outside and cooked well and moist on the inside. The waffles with our chicken and waffle main was nothing to write home about and their current dessert menu is rather uninspiring. Overall a ok experience.

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Bear - London, United Kingdom. My favourite starter warm spinach dip, cruites and cibbata
Photo of The Fat Bear - London, United Kingdom. Crispy pickles not my thing but my friend said they were lovely. Deviled eggs are cold but taste really good
Photo of The Fat Bear - London, United Kingdom. Cocktails to start why not ones a cosmo the other bit sure but nice with a slight bitter after taste

-BN2ymJIJiC5yrP2Ce4vjQ.text: Yelp's events put this place on my radar - I can't remember if I couldn't go or didn't get in but I've definitely had this one bookmarked for a long time. Today was finally the day! It was with some trepidation we headed up the stairs, especially as there isn't a hostess station. But it was all fine and we were quickly seated. The menu was full of things I wanted, so I went for two small plates - corn dogs with andouille sausage and pimento cheese with oatcakes. Both were delish! Definitely share the cheese with a couple people as it's a lot. Service was great. Coke is pricy at £2.50 for only 200ml. Next time will include the deep fried pickles. Or the cheesy spinach dip. And some Oreo cheesecake.

2NxnrbZ2tdhYk0TiUHgaUw.text: I'd bookmarked the Fat Bear some time ago just in case I was ever in the neighbourhood - that day came today!Firstly, don't be nervous about going up the stairs, it is the right place. Service was good, and we got a table for two without a problem.The menu is Deep South-ish. But there's some American classics too - deep fried pickles for example. I had two of the smaller plates, the chicken tenders and the gumbo. Both were excellent. The chicken was quite dark, but that's just buttermilk coating done right. Just the right consistency and the chicken was perfectly succulent. The gumbo was big for a little plate - they do it in two sizes and I thought I'd might have ordered the larger one by mistake. But it was the smaller one, which makes me wonder if I could have gone for a swim in the big one! ;)Great meal, good service, and I would happily come back.

Ii45KBRMXjCeeLAQrJI9Hw.text: Was pleasantly surprised with the execution of "Southern Comfort Food" here in the heart of London.  The ambience and vibe is easily replicated with blues playing and the requisite prohibition era speakeasy "gin joint" style cocktail menu.  However, deviled eggs and a solid bowl of gumbo (yes with okra) can't be faked, especially to an actual southerner.  I love London, but this was a nice taste of home and a lovely respite from pub and Indian food that I typically live off of while in jolly ole....  Crack on chaps!

oV7Q3T0CfjAUe7Df61ecJA.text: The location was slightly hard to find. It's at the top of a flight of stairs and it was only identifiable by a small sign on the street. The place has dark, relaxing lighting with a moderate noise level. I had the chicken sandwich which was very good and well cooked. My only complaint is the fries... they were too thin and "fast foodish" for the amount I paid.

photos.caption: Photo of The Fat Bear - London, United Kingdom

ZfW4nQPmjwKLM6XJxB4-jA.text: The vegan gumbo is very good, but it would be nice if it had tofu in it. If you don't like things hot and spicy you might not like it. Interesting vibe and atmosphere.

0-Xkv0PZkbGSUxBMHhIxEA.text: Made it here with a large group booking. Helped me with everything all the way through. Food was excellent and the group wasn't just crammed into a table far too small but instead almost given a whole room. The Oreo cheesecake is to die for aware the wings and chicken. Cocktails topped off a great experience

o5ZbLFyWPBpcs_etQe0-KA.text: Was so amazed at the high rating of this restaurant. Really nothing special and a bit of a disappointment.Quick and friendly service, lovely atmosphere. Check, check, check.Food was just very very average and bland. Not bad, just very boring. Nothing tasted bold, exciting or interesting. Tried buffalo wings: just tastes like Frank's hot sauce, sure thats the signature taste but dullFried pickles: nothingGumbo: like adult baby food, barely warm, where were the shrimps i was promised? Where is the flavour I hoped for? Dashed like my dreams.

lDoO5UMrZAvrCWrjq6ImhQ.text: Back again last week and good to see that things are going well for The Fat Bear.  This is the place for you if you appreciate good cocktails and Louisiana food. The service is excellent and music completes the effect without getting in the way.  The wine list is solid, and they know how to pair well.  Keep up the good work!

x6StD08NSbCnxvfahGdNHg.text: The Fat Bear cocktail is amazing, and I had some of the best Cajun food of my life here, and I live in the Southern United States.  Definitely try the Gumbo! It's so delicious, and definitely ask for their house made hot sauce! This place is amazing!

6yW4jUuUXmiyg_qwh9NG6g.text: Happened to be in the area and this seemed like a good place to eat.The place is small, it was a bit cold and the old building that this place is in didn't have the greatest heating. if you sit right by the heater (next two the window) your body will be hot and cold at the same time.Now the food. Ordered the chicken and waffles, there was nothing wrong with it, but it didn't really leave a lasting memory. Adjusting for this being in London, the food is good-  if you live in southern US, don't try to compare, it's a different experience. I can't comment on the price, everything in London seems out of wack to me.. .it's more than what I would pay in Texas for same food... but this ain't Texas and I'm sure their rent is a lot higher!

q3_Ov_wrIj-uqO5nm-G8Uw.text: On my second night in London (on a Saturday), I went to this restaurant when it was basically dead. Like I was the only customer there. So it was a great experience. The street that the restaurant is on was dead on a Saturday night....I heard 9-5ers populate that area after work. The staff was very friendly and my waiter/bartender was really cool and fun! That was actually the best part of the restaurant...the customer service and the staff as a whole. It was very dark and small but this created a soothing ambience throughout. I did order chicken and waffles and it was pretty good..however I would have liked my chicken cooked a little more. I felt it was a bit too tender. I'm from New Jersey and grew up on soul food so it was a nice attempt I must say. I really liked my experience. And the drinks were very good. A little pricey but good. I had a great time overall!

ct-kJDXFMm_geDEKn6BvtA.text: If you're visiting London you MUST come here! The food is absolutely amazing! Like nothing I've ever tasted before. I ordered the gumbo which was gorgeous, corn dogs which were so tasty, and the cornbread. The cornbread was easily the star of the meal as it tasted like heaven!!!

Y-0o9EoDxZVDzH_01ruuEw.text: Dined with colleagues while in London for business.   I didn't know what to order because everything looked scrumptious.   I chose the set menu which included a beverage, starter, entree and dessert. The spinach dip was yummy.  Amazing even when out of tostinis.   The fried chicken and waffles was out of this world.   Top two best fried chicken I have had.    Dessert also yummy with a trio of three ice creams.   Ambiance was chill. Small place but I loved that.   Dark but it was not off putting.    Solo diners and small groups appeared equally comfy.    Staff were very friendly.    So enjoyed our time there.   I will be back for sure.

af_2bOY91oVYGdCxNHydHQ.text: Overall disappointing. Mixed results on he meal. The fried chicken was good but not great. It came out hot and crispy but didn't have very much flavour or juicy enough for a 5 star piece of chicken. The waffles were offensively bad. They looked and tasted like frozen waffles. Thin, soggy and a little freezer burn flavour. The syrup was this sriracha maple sauce which was ok but didn't add enough depth of flavour to make it worth using over a good maple. Felt like it went with the chicken but fought with the waffle. I would have preferred a classic maple and then add flavour with a side of country gravy. If all you want is a decent piece of crunchy fried chicken, this is a fine place. For the rest of the dish, meh. Not sure this was good enough to inspire another visit to try the rest of the menu.

mjOHHVvmyW1kOZn3aBxlDA.text: Great ambiance, great service, wonderful food, fun drinks. I rarely give a 5 out of 5 stars but this came close. Waiter was helpful with recommendations, and wasn't pushy. We got wings and chips, as the BF was on the fence about chicken and waffles. Being from the States and loving the south, I was torn with what to order but ended up going with chicken and waffles. It's not your typical southern-style chicken n waffles but this was a nice flair on the normal dish. With the dish came a honey mustard syrup - which, like the chicken, was a nice twist on the normal maple syrup. BF ordered chicken wings which were too hot for him so we swapped plates. We were both happy with the dishes! I also had a rootbeer flats - yummy drink :) Overall, I'd recommend it if you're in the area. If you're not close, I wouldn't go toooo far out of your way for it. It's very small, quaint, and intimate and does require a tight staircase to ascend to get to the restaurant so if you do have a disability that interrupts your mobility, I would avoid this restaurant.

V5DNacmEknca_SZIldYqiQ.text: Small restaurant and it was very hard to find. The chicken was fried very hard and my husbands chicken had blood in it. Mine was good but a bit burnt. It wouldn't be my first choice.
